forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. North northeast wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 43. North northeast wind 7 to 13 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The morning in Downtown San Francisco unfolds under a canopy of shifting clouds, with a gentle breeze ushering in an air heavy with the promise of rain. Today’s high of around 54 degrees hints at a day made for layers; a light jacket and perhaps a scarf would provide comfort against the chill that creeps into the afternoon. The sky, though partly sunny at moments, anticipates a 50% chance of rain, with darkened clouds gathering in the distance, reminding us of the city’s ever-changing moods.

As the day progresses, one might notice veils of fog rolling through the hills and along the bay, occasionally obscuring the iconic outlines of the Golden Gate or the towers of Downtown. The marine layer dances between appearances, creating a serene yet intriguing atmosphere that invites gentle strolls along the Embarcadero, where the fragrance of salt and damp earth mingles in the air. Maybe try a cozy café, where the warmth of a latte could cradle you against the coolness outside, or take a contemplative walk through one of the city’s lush parks. Embrace the beauty of the moment, even as the clouds gather; there’s a certain charm in the stillness before the rain.
